meanings.definition: Make or become urban in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The small village was urbanised when new buildings and roads were constructed.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the rural area slowly urbanised as more people moved in.
meanings.sent3: The cows in the field looked quite urbanised with their fancy hats and sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: Her music taste urbanised rapidly, shifting from country to hip hop in just a month.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline urbanised with bright lights and towering skyscrapers.

meanings.definition: Develop or be developed into a town or city.
meanings.sent1: The empty land was urbanised into a bustling city with tall buildings and busy streets.
meanings.sent2: The once quiet town urbanised as more businesses opened and people settled there.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome decided to urbanise and move to the city for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of success urbanised into a thriving metropolis of achievements and opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The old factory site urbanised into a vibrant community with parks and schools.
